description: {"blocks":[{"key":"59p8h","text":"This protocol described how to differentiate hiPSCs to forebrain neural progenitor cells using dual SMAD inhibition","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Aligning Science Across Parkinson’s through the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ikeg","text":"Human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs) are rinsed once with DPBS (GIBCO) and dissociated when 70-90% confluent with 0.5 mM EDTA (75 ml/cm2; GIBCO) at   for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":157,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":163,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4ge27","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3194DDA0A16211EDA6AE2D13A018ADFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":420,"guid":"558F0990A14B11ED8083E9924F876207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ftvo","text":"Dissociated cells are then carefully washed away from the wells and collected in wash medium (  DMEM/F-12 (31330-038; GIBCO) and   knockout serum replacement (GIBCO)).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":81,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":94,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":129,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20maf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9.5","error":false,"guid":"3A77CC70A16211EDA6AE2D13A018ADFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"36F8DEE0A16211EDA6AE2D13A018ADFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etu4u","text":"The cells are then centrifuged at   for  and resuspended in iPS brew medium (StemMACS iPS-Brew XF and 0.5% penicillin/streptomycin (GIBCO)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9ag0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"591A5BC0A16211EDA6AE2D13A018ADFA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"DD3DDA20A14F11ED8083E9924F876207","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: hiPSCs differentiation into fbNPCs via dual SMAD inhibition
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88jaq","text":"The protocol is based on the one described in Nolbrant et al., 2017 and Grassi et al., 2019.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":21},{"key":1,"offset":72,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"e965k","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d7ni","text":"Day 0 of differentiation. The resuspended cells are then plated on LN111-coated (1.14µg/cm2; Biolamina) coated Nunc multidishes at a density of 10000 cells/cm2 and grown in N2 medium (1:1 DMEM/F-12 (21331020; GIBCO) and Neurobasal (21103049; GIBCO) supplemented with 1% N2 (GIBCO), 2 mM L-glutamine (GIBCO), and 0.2% penicillin/streptomycin). 10 μM of Y27632 (Rock inhibitor; Miltenyi) are also added to the cells when plating. Finally, 10 μM SB431542 (Axon) and 100 ng/ml noggin (Miltenyi) for dual SMAD inhibition are supplemented to the media. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":26},{"style":"sup","offset":158,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":173,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0FF327D0A15111EDB936753DEA0BB177","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2017.078"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"26B6A3C0A15111EDB936753DEA0BB177","url":"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S240584401936726X?via%3Dihub"}}}}

steps.section: hiPSCs differentiation into fbNPCs via dual SMAD inhibition
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vhf5","text":"The media, supplemented with dual SMAD inhibitors, is changed every 2-3 days until day 9 of differentiation. The amount of media is slightly increased at every feeding as the cells' confluency increases. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":83,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: hiPSCs differentiation into fbNPCs via dual SMAD inhibition
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fl6d2","text":"Day 9 of differentiation. The cells are fed with N2 media without dual SMAD inhibitors. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: hiPSCs differentiation into fbNPCs via dual SMAD inhibition
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"91g1m","text":"Day 11 of differentiation. The cells are dissociated, centrifuged, and resuspended as described above (hiPSCs dissociation SECTION). They are then replated on LN111-coated Nunc multidishes at a density of 800000 cells/cm2 in B27 medium (Neurobasal supplemented with 1% B27 without vitamin A (GIBCO), 2 mM L-glutamine and 0.2% penicillin/streptomycin Y27632 (10 μM), BDNF (20 ng/ml; R\u0026D), and L-ascorbic acid (0.2 mM; Sigma)). 10 μM of Y27632 are also added. The cells are kept in the same medium until day 14 of differentiation, when they are harvested for downstream analyses (e.g. bulk RNA sequencing).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":27},{"style":"italic","offset":502,"length":27},{"style":"sup","offset":220,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":225,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
